intro: Anosporum, commonly known as the false lichen, is a genus of lichens that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. These organisms are composite life forms consisting of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic alga or cyanobacterium. Anosporum species are typically found growing on bark, rocks, or soil in temperate and boreal regions. They are characterized by their leathery, crust-like thallus and often exhibit a range of colors from green to yellowish-gray. Due to their slow growth and ecological significance, they play an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in their habitats.
